snippet: The United States has the credibility to borrow from foreign investors in a currency it can print and under laws it can change, but a default could jeopardize that.
abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column notes that United States is one of only a few nations with enough credibility to borrow from foreign investors in a currency it can print, and under laws it can change; argues that this key advantage would be jeopardized should United States default on its debt, price that is far too great to pay over health care dispute.
lead_paragraph: The United States has the credibility to borrow from foreign investors in a currency it can print and under laws it can change, but a default could jeopardize that.

headline.print_headline: At Risk: Currency Privilege Of the Dollar
headline.main: At Risk: Currency Privilege of the Dollar

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
